item.title: Home
item.dc:creator: mccrmck
item.content:encoded:
Mike McCormick (he/him) is an artist and programmer working with sound, text, and visual media. Equally inspired by the constrained writing techniques of the Oulipo and the technomaterialism espoused by Xenofeminism, his work combines custom algorithms with human performers and autobiographical material to explore human intimacy, male vulnerability, and our relationship with emerging technologies. He grew up in Canada’s subarctic, lived nomadically for a decade, and has been based in Oslo since 2017.

In addition to his personal output, his recent collaborators include puppeteer Kira Hall, choreographer Lisa Colette Bysheim, and post-vaporwave band Meat.Karaoke.Quality.Time.

item.title: Catalogue
item.dc:creator: mccrmck

item.title: Proxemics
item.dc:creator: mccrmck
item.content:encoded:
the branch of knowledge that deals with the amount of space people feel necessary to set between themselves and others.

In the summer of 2016, Mike McCormick decided to address his performative limitations by composing a set of personalized technical studies for the electric guitar. Exploring the physical and practical distance between him and his instrument encouraged him to examine other “distances” in various aspects of his life. This lead him to compile a collection of saved letters, emails, and electronic messages sent to him from partners with whom he had been previously intimately involved in order to examine the emotional “spaces” he had created in his past.

Spanning more than a decade and a variety of relationships, these correspondences reveal the complex nature of human intimacy – some messages show the unabashed beauty of unconditional love, others reveal the bitterness of heartbreak, and still others expose the volatility of passionate lust.

Proxemic Studies: Volume I was released on Norwegian label Smeik on February 8, 2020.

item.title: ternOP
item.dc:creator: mccrmck
item.content:encoded:
ternOP is the latest project from Oslo-based improvisers Håkon Norby Bjørgo and Mike McCormick. Having played together for several years in the dynamic guitar trio BRINICLE, they are now exploring the depth and breadth of their intuitive connection in an entirely new setting. McCormick has dedicated the recent years to developing an improvisational vocabulary with his laptop, and this setting sees him performing real-time transformations of Bjørgo’s virtuosic contrabass playing.

In computer science, a ternary OPerator is a statement that takes three arguments - the third contributing element of their performance is an algorithm written by McCormick in the SuperCollider programming environment. This algorithm analyzes the music created by Bjørgo’s performance and McCormick’s processing, and then acts independently by altering processes or instigating new ones.

Their debut album "Let them eat the rich" was released on Smia records in 2022.

item.title: SC Journals
item.dc:creator: mccrmck
item.content:encoded: A series of audiovisual pieces that explore complex topics through humor, philosophy and my personal experiences and reflections. The pieces are made in SuperCollider (SC), a programming language designed for creating, manipulating, and analysing sound.

item.title: EIDOLON
item.dc:creator: mccrmck
item.content:encoded: In October 2018, vocalist Mascha Corman asked Mike McCormick to play a duo concert with her in Switzerland, knowing very well that he was scheduled to be in Canada at the time. She wanted to be able to engage with his improvising electronics without him present in an effort to explore the performative possibilities that lie between solo and duo settings. His response was to create the EIDOLON, an algorithmic improvising program written in the SuperCollider programming environment. An ongoing work-in-progress, the EIDOLON listens to Mascha’s performance, analyses the current musical situation, and independently makes decisions that inform the generated sounds and transformations of her voice.
item.excerpt:encoded: An interactive improvising algorithm written in the SuperCollider programming environment.

item.title: YAWN
item.dc:creator: mccrmck
item.content:encoded: Influenced in equal parts by modern progressive metal, American/European jazz traditions, and contemporary electroacoustic music, Yawn is band unlike any other. Their high-energy performances feature virtuosic sound design, machine-like rhythmic precision, and a larger-than-life light show - all synchronized by custom-made software. Their debut album Materialism was released on Mindsweeper Records in early 2022 to rave reviews: https://www.yawn.no/

item.title: Jan Syvertsen - 2021-09-15 14:07:23
item.content:encoded:
Hei Mike.
Dette er en personlig invitasjon til deg som er musiker .
Vi er Jan Syvertsen (55) fra Kristiansand og Rune Moe (42) fra Oslo som har en felles hobby i å samle på autografer fra norske musikere og band i alle sjangere. Vi har gått i dypdykk i norsk musikkhistorie og allerede samlet autografer fra hundrevis av norske musikere. Vi møtes 2-3 ganger i året for å treffe musikere og samle autografer. Vi ønsker på denne måten å ta vare på norsk musikk-historie og kulturliv.
Vi driver også litt med musikk på amatør basis. Jan synger i bandet Grace på Sørlandet. Rune har vært med i og er med i flere 60s/Shadowband som Tasty og The Cliftones, og har backet artister som Anita Hegerland, Christian Ingebrigtsen, Dag Ingebrigtsen og Svein Finjarn.
På Kaffistova inviterer vi deg/dere til å komme (drop in) å signere bilder, både solo-bilder og eventuelle bilder av band du har vært med i. Mange bandbilder er allerede signert av noen av medlemmer og andre av ingen. Vi har bl.a noen bilder av OJKOS.
Høsten 2020 hadde vi et liknende arrangement på Brygg i Oslo og vi er overveldet over responsen vi fikk da. En del av dere som inviteres nå var også invitert da. Vi håper det kan passe denne gangen.
Ta gjerne en titt på bildene i dette arrangementet - det er bilder fra vårt forrige arrangement, samt noen smakebiter fra samlingene våre. https://www.facebook.com/events/538329467405054
Vi håper du/dere har mulighet til å komme. Vi hadde satt stor pris på om du markerer om du kan komme eller ikke på invitasjonen. Da er vi enda bedre forberedt. Uansett har vi printer og kan skrive ut bilder fortløpende på Kaffistova.
Det betyr svært mye for oss om du/dere har mulighet til å stikke innom.
Hvor: kjelleren på Kaffistova, Kristian IVs gate 2, 0159 Oslo
Når:
Fredag 1. oktober kl 11:30-21:00
Lørdag 2. oktober kl 11:30-19:00
Velkommen!
Beste hilsen
Rune Moe, mobil 41128440
E-post: rune.moe@gmail.com
Jan Syvertsen, mobil 41622748

item.title: Stephanie Haywood - 2021-10-07 15:10:27
item.content:encoded:
Hello!
I was wondering if I could submit a guest article for your website. I'd like to share task management skills I've learned as a small business owner that can be used in all aspects of your life.
Does this sound like something you'd be interested in sharing with your readers?
Thanks for your time! Stephanie Haywood mylifeboost.com
P.S. I'd love to promote your site within the piece as well! Let me know if there's a particular page or blog post you have in mind. <!--more--> AUTHOR: Stephanie Haywood AUTHOR EMAIL: info@mylifeboost.com AUTHOR URL: SUBJECT: [Mike McCormick] Contact IP: 41.210.146.156 Array ( [1_Name] => Stephanie Haywood [2_Email] => info@mylifeboost.com [3_Message] => Hello!

item.title: Stivix Technologies - 2021-12-28 12:14:23
item.content:encoded:
Hi, A well-designed modern website/web application can drive traffic and henceforth sales. We can offer you the service that you were most awaited for.
We have analyzed your current website (mikemccormickmusic.com) and it looks like it needs to upgrade to a modern website. We guarantee that if you have a modern website, you will have more customers.
> Logo should be eye-catchy > Website should have a visible favicon > Mobile number should be clickable > Payment gateway can be implemented to your website for customers
We can build/redesign your website just the way you want it from the scratch. And of course for an affordable price which could be an hourly rate - 12USD/hour (It's 75% lower than the European rate) or a fixed rate. And also we can guarantee you the uniqueness and attractiveness of your website/web application.
If you can spare a minute or two, kindly visit our website (https://stivix.com) and the success stories here. Should you decide to accept our proposal, please inform us!
Thanks, STIVIX | Marketing Team, https://stivix.com <!--more--> AUTHOR: Stivix Technologies AUTHOR EMAIL: hello@stivix.com AUTHOR URL: SUBJECT: [Mike McCormick] Contact IP: 112.134.220.54 Array ( [1_Name] => Stivix Technologies [2_Email] => hello@stivix.com [3_Message] => Hi, A well-designed modern website/web application can drive traffic and henceforth sales. item.title: Sarah Williams - 2022-02-07 12:22:22
item.content:encoded: Greetings to you, I am Mrs. Sarah Williams, I am 63 years old, I write to relate to you of my intention to use my late husband's fund for charity work in your country. I was married to late Mr. Fred Williams who was a contractor with the Government of Ivory Coast before he died after few days in the hospital. I have been suffering from cancer. I want to know if I can trust you to use these funds for charity/orphanage work in the world. Please contact me on this email address for more details. ( sarahwilli943@gmail.com ) Yours Mrs. Sarah Williams. <!--more--> AUTHOR: Sarah Williams AUTHOR EMAIL: sarahwilli943@gmail.com AUTHOR URL: SUBJECT: [Mike McCormick] Contact IP: 196.47.134.49 Array ( [1_Name] => Sarah Williams [2_Email] => sarahwilli943@gmail.com [3_Message] => Greetings to you, I am Mrs. Sarah Williams, I am 63 years old, I write to relate to you of my intention to use my late husband's fund for charity work in your country. item.title: Custom Template
item.dc:creator: mccrmck

item.title: under: went
item.dc:creator: mccrmck
item.content:encoded:
Content Warning; This performance includes depictions of suicidal ideation and a depressive episode which may be triggering for some.

In a moment of hysteria and extreme desperation while living in Oslo, Norway, Mike McCormick approached a river running through the city and considered drowning himself in it. Before doing so, he began recording a voice memo with his phone so as to capture his thoughts in that moment and leave behind a message. Thankfully, Mike survived this experience and this recording stands as a document of his extreme emotional state. In under: went, excerpts from this recording form one half of a dialogue with soprano Jessica Wagner in an attempt to explore the candid reality of depression, a condition that touches everyone (directly or indirectly) but is still difficult for many to discuss.
item.excerpt:encoded: A work for soprano Jessica Wagner and electronics that explores the candid reality of depression and suicidal ideation
